ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English *until*, combining Old Norse *und* (up to, as far as) and *til* (to). The word *till* is a shortened form and alternative.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: preposition (links a noun or pronoun to another word)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Up to the time of; marking the boundary or end point of a period of time or an action.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 直到...的时候为止；在...之前
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The library is open until 9 p.m. on weekdays.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 图书馆在工作日开放到晚上九点。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: conjunction (joins clauses or sentences, often introducing a subordinate time clause)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Up to the time when; during the period preceding the moment when something else happens.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We can't start the party until everyone has arrived.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们不能开始派对，直到所有人都到齐为止。
